snippet: Advanced Micro Devices is rushing to refocus as consumers buy fewer laptops and more tablets and smartphones.
abstract: Advanced Micro Devices reports second-quarter loss of $74 million, or 10 cents a share, compared with profit of $37 million, or 5 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $1.16 billion, down from $1.41 billion year ago.
lead_paragraph: Advanced Micro Devices is rushing to refocus as consumers buy fewer laptops and more tablets and smartphones.

headline.main: A.M.D. Sees Higher Revenue in Move Into Game Market
headline.print_headline: A.M.D. Sees Higher Revenue In Move Into Game Market
